intro: Conostephium uncinatum, commonly known as the hooked conostephium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pink flowers that bloom in winter. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Conostephium uncinatum is often found in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas.
